ETYMOLOGY: From British English dialect; probably an alteration of 'taffy', first attested in the early 19th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). [U] means uncountable, [C] means countable.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A sweet, chewy candy made by boiling sugar and butter together, often with other ingredients like nuts or flavorings, then cooled into a hard or semi-hard mass.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由糖和黄油煮沸制成的甜而有嚼劲的糖果，通常还会加入坚果或其他调味料，然后冷却成坚硬或半坚硬的块状。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She bought a box of assorted toffees from the sweet shop.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她从糖果店买了一盒什锦太妃糖。
